name: Name
overallAPILastAccessTimesTitle: API Last Access Times (Across All Versions)
usageByCurrentSubscribersAcrossAll: Usage by Current Subscribers (Across All Versions)
nameHelpMsg: Display name to be shown in the API Store.
contextHelpMsg: URI context path of the API.
tierHelpMsg: Tiers limit the number of requests a subscriber can make to an API. An API can be exposed over one or more tiers. The Gold, Silver and Bronze tiers allow 20, 5 and 1 request/s respectively per minute.
roleHelpMsg:
Public : The API is accessible to everyone and can be advertised in multiple stores - a central store and/or non-WSO2 stores.
Visible to my domain : The API is visible to all users who are registered in the API's tenant domain.
Restricted by roles : The API is visible only to specific user roles in the tenant store that you specify.
docRoleHelpMsg:
Same as API visibility: Visible to the same user roles who can see the API.
Visible to my domain : Visible to all registered users in the API's tenant domain.
Private: Visible only to the API creator's role.
tenantRoleHelpMsg: This option controls the API visibility based on the tenant.
tagsHelpMsg: Use keywords and common search terms as tags to group APIs that have similar characteristics. After publishing the API, consumers can click these tags to jump to a group of similar APIs.
allowTenantsHelpMsg: Comma separated list (e.g.,: tenant1.com,tenant2.com). Your API will be accessible to those defined Tenants as well.
noLifecycleMsg: No Lifecycle history can be found for this API.
noAPIsMsg1: No APIs created yet. Click the button below to get started.
noApisByProviderMsg: No APIs provided by the user
revokeHelpMsg: Search Options - 1) By Access Token [Default]  2) By Authorized User ->user:xxxx  3) By Created Date -> after:yyyy-mm-dd  or before:yyyy-mm-dd
noDocsMsg: No documentation associated with the API
revokeHelpMsg3: By Authorized User - Syntax - user:xxxxx or
revokeHelpMsg4: By Created Date - Syntax - after:yyyy-mm-dd  or before:yyyy-mm-dd
cacheHelpMsg: This option determines whether to cache the response messages of the API. Caching improves performance, because the backend server does not have to process the same data for a request multiple times. To offset the risk of stale data in the cache, set an appropriate timeout period when prompted.
apiMgrGuide: WSO2 Practical Guide to API Management
useCase1: WSO2 Use Case: API Facade Pattern
sequenceMsg: Check to select a custom sequence to be executed in the message flow
statsHelpMsg: Enable this feature to see a graph (in the Statistics menu ) of the number of requests that leave the API Gateway to destination endpoints (e.g., Load-balanced endpoints).
subscriptionHelpMsg: This option specifies the tenants who can subscribe to an API in a multi-tenanted setup. Available to current Tenant Only: only users in the current organization/tenant domain can subscribe to the API Available to All the Tenants: users of all organizations/tenant domains can subscribe to the API Available to Specific Tenants: users of the organizations/tenant domains you specify as well as the current tenant domain can subscribe to the API
defaultAPIHelpMsg: Marks one API version in a group as the default, so that it can be invoked without specifying the version number in the URL. For example, if you mark http://host:port/youtube/2.0 as the default API, requests made to http://host:port/youtube/ are automatically routed to version 2.0. If you mark an unpublished API as the default, the previous default, published API will still be used as the default until the new default API is published
transportHelpMsg: The transport protocol/s on which the API is exposed.
endpointSecHelpMsg: To connect to secured endpoints, you need to pass the credentials of the backend service.
versionCopyHelpMsg: Marks one API version in a group as the default one, so that it can be invoked without specifying the version number in the URL. For example, if you mark http://host:port/youtube/2.0 as the default API, requests made to http://host:port/youtube/ gets automatically routed to version 2.0. If you mark an unpublished API as the default while the previously default API was a published one, the users who invoke the default API will still be routed to the previous default version rather than the new one. This is because the new version is not published yet.
lifecycleHelpMsg: CREATED: API metadata is saved, but it is not visible to subscribers yet, nor deployed to the API Gateway.PUBLISHED: API is visible in API Store, and eventually published if the Propagate Changes to API Gateway option is selected at publishing time.DEPRECATED: API is still deployed into API Gateway (available at runtime to existing users), but not visible to subscribers. An API is automatically deprecated when a new version is published.RETIRED: API is unpublished from the API gateway and deleted from the store.BLOCKED: Access is temporarily blocked. Runtime calls are blocked and the API is not shown in the API store anymore.
fileDocTypeHelpMsg: eg : pdf, xml, txt, wsdl, ms-word, ms-powerpoint, ms-excel
urlDocHelpMsg: Link to documentation managed by an external configuration management system
inlineDocHelpMsg: Documentation that is hosted in the system and can be edited directly from the UI
inlineEphelp: Specify the implementation of the API using in-line JavaScript
wsdlDescHelpMsg: The content the WSDL is saved as a resource in /system/governance/apimgt/applicationdata/wsdls registry location. API artifacts have a dependency to this resource. Its original service address is reset to the API Gateway's address to prevent direct calls to the service endpoint. The registry permlink of the WSDL resource is shown in the API Store and users can download and create a service out of it.
removeAPIFromExternalStoresWarning: This API is not PUBLISHED. Please remove from external stores.
